faq.title: Post Office & PIN Code Search - Frequently Asked Questions

q1.question: What is an Indian Postal PIN Code?
q1.answer: A Postal Index Number (PIN), or Pincode, is a 6-digit code used by India Post for sorting mail. Each digit has a specific geographical meaning, helping to route mail efficiently. This PIN code finder for India helps you get details for any postal code.

q2.question: How do I perform an India PIN code search?
q2.answer: You can use our 'Search by Pincode' page and enter the 6-digit code to see a list of post offices associated with it. Alternatively, on the home page, you can search Indian post offices by state and district to find the correct PIN code for any location. This is the most comprehensive postal code finder online.

q3.question: What post office details can I find?
q3.answer: Our Indian Post Office database provides comprehensive details for each branch, including the office name, 6-digit pincode, office type (Head Post Office, Sub-Office, or Branch Post Office), district, state, and the postal division, region, and circle it belongs to.

q4.question: Can I get a post office list by state?
q4.answer: Yes. Simply select a state from the dropdown on our homepage. You can then see all post offices in that state, and further filter by a specific postal division or district to see a complete post office list for that area. This allows you to explore the India post office PIN code directory for any state.

q5.question: What is the difference between a Head Post Office and a Branch Post Office?
q5.answer: A Head Post Office (H.O.) or General Post Office (G.P.O) is the main post office in a postal district, which controls and manages the smaller Branch Post Offices (B.O.) and Sub-Post Offices (S.O.) in its jurisdiction. Our tool provides details for all types, from a major G.P.O. to the smallest branch office.

q6.question: How accurate is the Indian Post Office database?
q6.answer: We use the official, publicly available All India Pincode Directory data from the Government of India. This ensures our post office search online provides the most accurate and up-to-date post office and pincode details India has on record.

q7.question: How do I find post office details using a PIN code?
q7.answer: Navigate to the 'Search by Pincode' page using the main menu. Enter the complete 6-digit Indian Postal PIN Code into the search bar and click 'Search'. You will receive a list of all post offices, including their names, types, and districts, that fall under that specific postal code.

about.title: About digi-pincode
about.p1: Welcome to digi-pincode, your one-stop solution for finding postal information across India. Our mission is to provide an easy-to-use, fast, and reliable tool for looking up pincodes, postal codes, and post office details.
about.p2: This application is built with modern web technologies to ensure a seamless experience on any device. We leverage the official Indian postal data API to provide you with the most accurate and up-to-date information available.
about.p3: Whether you're sending a letter, shipping a package, or just curious about a location's PIN code, digi-pincode is here to help.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.p1: Have questions or feedback? We'd love to hear from you. Reach out to us through any of the channels below.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.p1: Your privacy is important to us. It is digi-pincode's policy to respect your privacy regarding any information we may collect from you across our website.
privacy.p2: We do not collect any personally identifiable information from our users. Our service allows you to search for postal information without requiring you to create an account or provide any personal data.
privacy.p3: The data you enter (such as pincodes or location names) is used solely to query the public API from data.gov.in to fetch the postal information you requested. We do not store your search queries.
privacy.p4: We do not use cookies to track users or store personal information. Our website is designed to be stateless from a user perspective.
privacy.p5: This website uses the Government of India's public API (data.gov.in) to provide postal information. We are not responsible for the privacy practices of this third-party service. We encourage you to read their privacy policies.
privacy.p6: We may update our Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page. You are advised to review this Privacy Policy periodically for any changes.
privacy.p7: If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, you can contact us via the details on our Contact Us page.
